channel.title: Cleaning off my computer
channel.description:
So i have a 450gb HD that is almost completely full. I have a strong urge to wipe it and put a fresh install on it just to get that 'new' feeling again. But i have tons of shit on here that i *think* i might need again or want to have in the future so i keep postponing the wipe.
Im going to assume some of you have encountered this problem, whats the best way of doing this? Going through and manually getting rid of stuff you dont need and then backing up and wiping? I was thinking of putting everything into one folder and give myself 30 days to naturally take stuff out of the folder i need, but im still worried i might need something again.
To give an example of how cluttered it is, i have a folder on my desktop that i throw EVERYTHING in that i dont want to delete and that i dont want to leave on my desktop.
Somehow i think wiping it all will benefit me because ill have to create new assets graphics wise, which means ill learn more. dunno, suggestions?
ITS A LAPTOP
!!!

item.title: Cleaning off my computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’ve often considered cleaning out my computer, and sometimes I delete a few files, but I always just end up buying another hard drive. (do you have a desktop?, put another HD in there and then share it with samba or similar)

Read full topic

item.title: Cleaning off my computer
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

I have a 320gb, Normally i just borrow my friends Portable HD, transfer all the stuff i want over and the Format my pc… But this time i uninstalled everything i didnt want and deleted all the stuff i didnt need, Freed about 80gb

Read full topic

item.title: Cleaning off my computer
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Surely, as said, the best way would to just get a nice portable drive? But its always good to have a clean out of all the shite thats collected over the months.

Read full topic

item.title: Cleaning off my computer
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I’m in the same boat you’re in with my laptop.

The only thing is, I know if I wipe it, my 100GB linux partition will take over the entire computer and I won’t bother to install Windows again.

Read full topic

item.title: Cleaning off my computer
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

That is what im currently looking into, but im on a laptop so finding one for a reasonable price is a bit difficult.

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822242011&cm_re=500gb_external--22-242-011--Product ?

Read full topic

item.title: Cleaning off my computer
item.dc:creator: @mapu mapu
item.description:
@mapu wrote:

Buy a 1tb portable HDD. Horde stuff in there.

Read full topic

item.title: Cleaning off my computer
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Buy a new drive (1-2tb’s are piss cheap now) and create one partition for your OS and one for your data (a 20/80% split works well for most). Install the OS on that drive and start copying whatever you need from the old drive to the new data partition. You can even redirect the documents/music/pictures folders of your new OS to the data partition. With this in place, you’ll be able to reinstall your OS as often as you want and never have to worry about losing data. You can use the old drive for backups and whatnot.

WOULD HAVE HELPED IF YOU MENTIONED IT WAS A LAPTOP.

Read full topic
